author: philip
msg: Implement status using per-dir queries.  On my machine (Linux, local
disk) this improves the speed of status on a Subversion trunk working
copy by a factor of 3, with a hot-cache, and about 30% with a cold cache.
1.7 is still slower than 1.6 for the hot-cache (but it's less than 100%),
but for cold-cache 1.7 is now faster than 1.6.
(read_info, get_repos_root_url_relpath): New, based on code from
(assemble_status): Add struct svn_wc__db_info_t parameter, use it
instead of querying the database, get relpath/root later to avoid
(get_dir_status): Add struct svn_wc__db_info_t parameter, use it
instead of querying the database, use svn_wc__db_read_children_info
instead of per-node queries, use get_repos_root_url_relpath,
